t: Luke 7
Jesus Heals a Centurion’s Servant
Now*p when He concluded all His sayings in the hearing of the people, He entered Capernaum.
And a certain centurion’s servant, who was dear to him, was sick and ready to die.
So when he heard about Jesus, he sent elders of the Jews to Him, pleading with Him to come and heal his servant.
And when they came to Jesus, they begged Him earnestly, saying that the one for whom He should do this was deserving,
“for he loves our nation, and has built us a synagogue.”

Then*p Jesus went with them. And when He was already not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to Him, saying to Him, “Lord, do not trouble Yourself, for I am not worthy that You should enter under my roof.
Therefore I did not even think myself worthy to come to You. But say the word, and my servant will be healed.
For I also am a man placed under authority, having soldiers under me. And I say to one, ‘Go,’ and he goes; and to another, ‘Come,’ and he comes; and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”*i

When*p Jesus heard these things, He marveled at him, and turned around and said to the crowd that followed Him, “I*r say*r to*r you,*r I*r have*r not*r found*r such*r great*r faith,*r not*r even*r in*r Israel!”*r
And those who were sent, returning to the house, found the servant well who had been sick.
Jesus Raises the Son of the Widow of Nain
Now*p it happened, the day after, that*i He went into a city called Nain; and many of His disciples went with Him, and a large crowd.
And when He came near the gate of the city, behold, a dead man was being carried out, the only son of his mother; and she was a widow. And a large crowd from the city was with her.
When the Lord saw her, He had compassion on her and said to her, “Do*r not*r weep.”*r
Then He came and touched the open coffin, and those who carried him*i stood still. And He said, “Young*r man,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r arise.”*r
So he who was dead sat up and began to speak. And He presented him to his mother.
Then*p fear came upon all, and they glorified God, saying, “A great prophet has risen up among us”; and, “God has visited His people.”
And this report about Him went throughout all Judea and all the surrounding region.
John the Baptist Sends Messengers to Jesus
Then*p the disciples of John reported to him concerning all these things.
And John, calling two of his disciples to him,*i sent them*i to Jesus, saying, “Are You the Coming One, or do we look for another?”
When*p the men had come to Him, they said, “John the Baptist has sent us to You, saying, ‘Are You the Coming One, or do we look for another?’”
And that very hour He cured many of infirmities, afflictions, and evil spirits; and to many blind He gave sight.

Jesus*p answered and said to them, “Go*r and*r tell*r John*r the*r things*r you*r have*r seen*r and*r heard:*r that*r the*ir blind*r see,*r the*ir lame*r walk,*r the*ir lepers*r are*r cleansed,*r the*ir deaf*r hear,*r the*ir dead*r are*r raised,*r the*ir poor*r have*r the*r gospel*r preached*r to*r them.*r
And*r blessed*r is*r he*ir who*r is*r not*r offended*r because*r of*r Me.”*r

When*p the messengers of John had departed, He began to speak to the multitudes concerning John: “What*r did*r you*r go*r out*r into*r the*r wilderness*r to*r see?*r A*r reed*r shaken*r by*r the*r wind?*r

But*r what*r did*r you*r go*r out*r to*r see?*r A*r man*r clothed*r in*r soft*r garments?*r Indeed*r those*r who*r are*r gorgeously*r appareled*r and*r live*r in*r luxury*r are*r in*r kings’*r courts.*r
But*r what*r did*r you*r go*r out*r to*r see?*r A*r prophet?*r Yes,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r and*r more*r than*r a*r prophet.*r
This*r is*r he*ir of*r whom*r it*r is*r written:*r ‘Behold,*rpn I*r send*r My*r messenger*r before*r Your*r face,*r Who*rld will*r prepare*r Your*r way*r before*r You.’*r

For*rp I*r say*r to*r you,*r among*r those*r born*r of*r women*r there*r is*r not*r a*r greater*r prophet*r than*r John*r the*r Baptist;*r but*r he*r who*r is*r least*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r is*r greater*r than*r he.”*r
And*p when all the people heard Him,*i even the tax collectors justified God, having been baptized with the baptism of John.
But the Pharisees and lawyers rejected the will of God for themselves, not having been baptized by him.
And*p the Lord said, “To*r what*r then*r shall*r I*r liken*r the*r men*r of*r this*r generation,*r and*r what*r are*r they*r like?*r

They*r are*r like*r children*r sitting*r in*r the*r marketplace*r and*r calling*r to*r one*r another,*r saying:*r ‘We*rpn played*r the*r flute*r for*r you,*r And*rld you*r did*r not*r dance;*r We*rld mourned*r to*r you,*r And*rld you*r did*r not*r weep.’*r
For*rp John*r the*r Baptist*r came*r neither*r eating*r bread*r nor*r drinking*r wine,*r and*r you*r say,*r ‘He*r has*r a*r demon.’*r
The*r Son*r of*r Man*r has*r come*r eating*r and*r drinking,*r and*r you*r say,*r ‘Look,*r a*r glutton*r and*r a*r winebibber,*r a*r friend*r of*r tax*r collectors*r and*r sinners!’*r
But*r wisdom*r is*r justified*r by*r all*r her*r children.”*r
A Sinful Woman Forgiven
Then*p one of the Pharisees asked Him to eat with him. And He went to the Pharisee’s house, and sat down to eat.
And behold, a woman in the city who was a sinner, when she knew that Jesus*i sat at the table in the Pharisee’s house, brought an alabaster flask of fragrant oil,

and stood at His feet behind Him*i weeping; and she began to wash His feet with her tears, and wiped them*i with the hair of her head; and she kissed His feet and anointed them*i with the fragrant oil.

Now when the Pharisee who had invited Him saw this,*i he spoke to himself, saying, “This Man, if He were a prophet, would know who and what manner of woman this*i is*i who is touching Him, for she is a sinner.”
And*p Jesus answered and said to him, “Simon,*r I*r have*r something*r to*r say*r to*r you.”*r So*p he said, “Teacher, say it.”
“There*rp was*r a*r certain*r creditor*r who*r had*r two*r debtors.*r One*r owed*r five*r hundred*r denarii,*r and*r the*r other*r fifty.*r
And*r when*r they*r had*r nothing*r with*r which*r to*r repay,*r he*r freely*r forgave*r them*r both.*r Tell*r Me,*r therefore,*r which*r of*r them*r will*r love*r him*r more?”*r
Simon*p answered and said, “I suppose the one*i whom he forgave more.” And*p He said to him, “You*r have*r rightly*r judged.”*r

Then He turned to the woman and said to Simon, “Do*r you*r see*r this*r woman?*r I*r entered*r your*r house;*r you*r gave*r Me*r no*r water*r for*r My*r feet,*r but*r she*r has*r washed*r My*r feet*r with*r her*r tears*r and*r wiped*r them*ir with*r the*r hair*r of*r her*r head.*r
You*r gave*r Me*r no*r kiss,*r but*r this*r woman*r has*r not*r ceased*r to*r kiss*r My*r feet*r since*r the*r time*r I*r came*r in.*r
You*r did*r not*r anoint*r My*r head*r with*r oil,*r but*r this*r woman*r has*r anointed*r My*r feet*r with*r fragrant*r oil.*r
Therefore*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r her*r sins,*r which*r are*ir many,*r are*r forgiven,*r for*r she*r loved*r much.*r But*r to*r whom*r little*r is*r forgiven,*r the*ir same*ir loves*r little.”*r
Then*p He said to her, “Your*r sins*r are*r forgiven.”*r
And*p those who sat at the table with Him began to say to themselves, “Who is this who even forgives sins?”
Then*p He said to the woman, “Your*r faith*r has*r saved*r you.*r Go*r in*r peace.”*r
